analyzed: khyod ji ltar dga' ba bzhin du bya'o //

original: zhes smras nas rgyal po des gzhung smra ba'i 'khor bsags te so so'i gzhung btsugs nas bu mo de yol ba'i nang du bzhag ste /
analyzed: zhes smras nas rgyal po des gzhung smra ba'i 'khor bsags te so so'i gzhung btsugs nas bu mo de yol ba'i nang du bzhag ste /
translated: The king gathered a group of proponents of other systems. They set up their own systems. The girl was placed behind a curtain.

original: bu mo des gzhung smra ba'i ri'u zhes bya ba gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa /
analyzed: bu mo des gzhung smra ba'i ri'u zhes bya ba gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa /
translated: The girl saw the handsome, good-looking, and attractive man named Śukra,

original: kha dog rgyas pa mchog dang ldan pa mthong nas de mthong ma thag tu 'dod chags kyi mdas phog ste /
analyzed: kha dog rgyas pa mchog dang ldan pa mthong nas de mthong ma thag tu 'dod chags kyi mdas phog ste /
translated: and as soon as she saw him, she was struck by the arrow of desire.

original: des bsam pa /
analyzed: des bsam pa /
translated: She thought,

original: bdag gis khyim thab 'di 'dra ba ga las kyang mi rnyed kyi /
analyzed: bdag gis khyim thab 'di 'dra ba ga las kyang mi rnyed kyi /
translated: “I will never find a husband like this.

original: 'di kho na bdag gi khyim thab tu bya dgos kyi gzhan ni mi 'dod do snyam du bsam nas des ci nas gzhung smra ba des bdag thub par 'gyur ba de ltar byas so //
analyzed: 'di kho na bdag gi khyim thab tu bya dgos kyi gzhan ni mi 'dod do snyam du bsam nas des ci nas gzhung smra ba des bdag thub par 'gyur ba de ltar byas so //
translated: I will make him my husband. I do not want anyone else.” She did whatever she could to win Śukra over.

original: de nas rgyal pos bsam pa /
analyzed: de nas rgyal pos bsam pa /
translated: Then the king thought,

original: bdag gis dam bcas pa la gzhung smra ba gang gis 'di thub par 'gyur ba de la bdag gis 'di sbyin par bya'i /🔽bdag gis 'di byad gzugs bzang ba la'ang @65a *//🔽mi sbyin; rigs mtho ba la'ang mi sbyin /
analyzed: bdag gis dam bcas pa la gzhung smra ba gang gis 'di thub par 'gyur ba de la bdag gis 'di sbyin par bya'i / bdag gis 'di byad gzugs bzang ba la'ang @65a *// mi sbyin; rigs mtho ba la'ang mi sbyin /
translated: “I have promised that I will give her to whoever can win her over.🔽I will not give her to someone just because they are good-looking,

original: dbang phyug dang ldan pa la'ang mi sbyin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang ldan pa la'ang mi sbyin no //
translated: or because they are of high caste,🔽or because they are powerful.”

original: zhes dam bcas pa las /
analyzed: zhes dam bcas pa las /
translated: He made a vow:

original: 'dis 'di thub par gyur la 'di'ang gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes te /
analyzed: 'dis 'di thub par gyur la 'di'ang gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes te /
translated: “If he can defeat him, he is handsome, good looking, and attractive.

original: bdag gis 'di las lhag pa gud nas gzhung smra ba ches khyad par du 'phags pa mi rnyed kyi /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di las lhag pa gud nas gzhung smra ba ches khyad par du 'phags pa mi rnyed kyi /
translated: I will not find a better debater than him.🔽I will give my daughter to him.”

original: ma la bdag gis 'di kho na la sbyin par bya'o snyam du bsam nas khyim pa rnams kyi khyim pa'i chos gang yin pa de bzhin du byas te /
analyzed: ma la bdag gis 'di kho na la sbyin par bya'o snyam du bsam nas khyim pa rnams kyi khyim pa'i chos gang yin pa de bzhin du byas te /
translated: He did as the householders do and gave his daughter to him.

original: bu mo de de la byin nas dbang phyug chen por yang bskos so //
analyzed: bu mo de de la byin nas dbang phyug chen por yang bskos so //
translated: He was also appointed as the lord of the great lords.

original: de'ang de dang lhan cig tu rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod do //
analyzed: de'ang de dang lhan cig tu rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod do //
translated: He played, took pleasure, and amused himself with her.

original: de nas phyi zhig na bu mo de la bu chags nas de zla ba dgu'am bcu lon pa dang khye'u gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig btsas te /
analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na bu mo de la bu chags nas de zla ba dgu'am bcu lon pa dang khye'u gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig btsas te /
translated: Later, she became pregnant, and after nine or ten months had passed, she gave birth to a child who was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful.

original: de'i btsas ston rgyas par byas nas khye'u 'di'i ming ji skad gdags zhes ming 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: de'i btsas ston rgyas par byas nas khye'u 'di'i ming ji skad gdags zhes ming 'dogs par byed de /
translated: They held an elaborate feast for his birth and gave him a name.

original: khye'u 'di rus k'a ty'a ya na yin la 'dus mo'i bu yin pas na 'dus pa'i k'a ty'a ya na zhes gdags so //
analyzed: khye'u 'di rus k'a ty'a ya na yin la 'dus mo'i bu yin pas na 'dus pa'i k'a ty'a ya na zhes gdags so //
translated: Since this child is of the Kātyāyana clan and is the son of a woman of the assembly, he will be called Saṃmata Kātyāyana.

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus it was said.

original: de nas khye'u 'dus pa'i k'a ty'a ya na 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang zhun mar dang mar gyi snying khus bskyed bsrings te mtsho'i nang gi padma bzhin du skye drag par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas khye'u 'dus pa'i k'a ty'a ya na 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang zhun mar dang mar gyi snying khus bskyed bsrings te mtsho'i nang gi padma bzhin du skye drag par gyur to //
translated: Then the child Saṃmata Kātyāyana was raised on milk, yogurt, butter, ghee, and milk solids, and he grew quickly like a lotus in a lake.

original: de nas de gang gi tshe cher skyes pa de'i tshe yi ge dang / bram ze'i spyod lam dang / spyod pa dang / ao zhes bya ba dang / bho zhes bya ba dang / gtsang sbra dang / cho ga dang / @65b thal ba blang ba dang /
analyzed: de nas de gang gi tshe cher skyes pa de'i tshe yi ge dang / bram ze'i spyod lam dang / spyod pa dang / ao zhes bya ba dang / bho zhes bya ba dang / gtsang sbra dang / cho ga dang / @65b thal ba blang ba dang /
translated: When he grew up, he learned letters, the conduct of brahmins, behavior, the sounds au and oṃ, purity, rituals, collecting ashes,

original: ril ba thogs pa dang / nges brjod kyi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang / snyan tshig gi rig byed dang / srid srung gi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin bya ba dang / mchod sbyin byed du gzhug pa dang / sbyin pa dang /
analyzed: ril ba thogs pa dang / nges brjod kyi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang / snyan tshig gi rig byed dang / srid srung gi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin bya ba dang / mchod sbyin byed du gzhug pa dang / sbyin pa dang /
translated: He learned how to hold a water pot, the Ṛg Veda, the Yajur Veda, the Sāma Veda, the Atharva Veda, how to perform sacrifices, how to make others perform sacrifices, how to give,

original: blang ba dang / kha ton bya ba dang / kha ton slob tu gzhug pa'i thabs bslabs nas las rnam pa drug la mkhas pa'i bram zer gyur te /
analyzed: blang ba dang / kha ton bya ba dang / kha ton slob tu gzhug pa'i thabs bslabs nas las rnam pa drug la mkhas pa'i bram zer gyur te /
translated: how to receive, how to recite, and how to teach recitation. He became a brahmin skilled in the six duties.

original: de mthar gyis rig pa'i gnas bco brgyad la byang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de mthar gyis rig pa'i gnas bco brgyad la byang bar gyur to //
translated: In due course, he became skilled in the eighteen branches of knowledge.

original: des lo bcu drug lon nas bstan bcos thams cad rtogs te gzhung smra ba thams cad tshar bcad nas de'i blo 'di lta bu zhig skyes te /
analyzed: des lo bcu drug lon nas bstan bcos thams cad rtogs te gzhung smra ba thams cad tshar bcad nas de'i blo 'di lta bu zhig skyes te /
translated: When he was sixteen years old, he understood all the treatises and defeated all the proponents of scriptures. He thought,

original: dzambu'i gling na bdag dang mnyam pa'ang med na /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling na bdag dang mnyam pa'ang med na /
translated: “In the world there is no one equal to me,

original: lhag pa lta ci smos snyam du rlom pa des skye bo phal po che la khyad du gsod par byed do //
analyzed: lhag pa lta ci smos snyam du rlom pa des skye bo phal po che la khyad du gsod par byed do //
translated: let alone someone greater.” He became arrogant and despised many people.

original: de nas dge bsnyen zhig gis de la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas dge bsnyen zhig gis de la smras pa /
translated: Then a lay vow holder said to him,

original: khye'u / khyod bdag dang mnyam pa su'ang med na /
analyzed: khye'u / khyod bdag dang mnyam pa su'ang med na /
translated: “Young man, if you think that there is no one equal to you,

original: lhag pa lta ci smos snyam du rlom pa 'dis rgyags par ma byed cig /
analyzed: lhag pa lta ci smos snyam du rlom pa 'dis rgyags par ma byed cig /
translated: let alone someone greater, do not be arrogant.

original: khye'u yul dbus na sh'akya'i bu zhig skyes pa de bram ze ltas mkhan bye brag phyed pa rnams kyis lung bstan te /
analyzed: khye'u yul dbus na sh'akya'i bu zhig skyes pa de bram ze ltas mkhan bye brag phyed pa rnams kyis lung bstan te /
translated: In the Middle Country there is a son of the Śākyas who was born. The brahmins who are experts in omens and signs have prophesied that

original: gal te khyim na gnas na ni /
analyzed: gal te khyim na gnas na ni /
translated: if he remains in the household

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: he will become a universal monarch.

original: gal te skra dang kha spu bregs te chos gos tshon can bgos nas yang dag pa'i dad pa kho nas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung na ni /
analyzed: gal te skra dang kha spu bregs te chos gos tshon can bgos nas yang dag pa'i dad pa kho nas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung na ni /
translated: But if he shaves his head and face and dons the colorful religious robes, and if he goes forth from the household to homelessness with true faith alone,

original: 'jig rten du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes sgra cher grags par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes lung @66a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes sgra cher grags par 'gyur ro // zhes lung @66a *//
translated: then he will become renowned in the world as a thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha.”

original: bstan pa las /
analyzed: bstan pa las /
translated: The young man asked,🔽“Where is this son of the Śākyas?”

original: de skra dang kha spu bregs te chos gos tshon can bgos nas yang dag pa'i dad pa kho nas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de la ni /
analyzed: de skra dang kha spu bregs te chos gos tshon can bgos nas yang dag pa'i dad pa kho nas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de la ni /
translated: He shaved off his hair and beard, put on the colorful religious robes, and with nothing but perfect faith went forth from home into homelessness. He became a perfectly enlightened Buddha.

original: khyod kyi gzugs dang shes rab kyis kyang brgya'i char yang mi phod /🔽stong gi char yang mi phod /
analyzed: khyod kyi gzugs dang shes rab kyis kyang brgya'i char yang mi phod / stong gi char yang mi phod /
translated: “Your beauty and wisdom do not amount even to a hundredth part of his.🔽They do not amount even to a thousandth part.🔽They do not amount even to a hundred-thousandth part.

original: 'bum gyi char yang mi phod; khrag khrig gi char yang mi phod de /
analyzed: 'bum gyi char yang mi phod; khrag khrig gi char yang mi phod de /
translated: They do not amount even to a one-hundred-millionth part.

original: grangs su bgrang du'ang med do //
analyzed: grangs su bgrang du'ang med do //
translated: They cannot be counted as a fraction.

original: zhes byas so //
analyzed: zhes byas so //
translated: Thus it is said.🔽🔽

original: de nas khye'u des sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra sngon ma thos pa thos nas spu thams cad zing zhes byas te lta 'dod par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas khye'u des sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra sngon ma thos pa thos nas spu thams cad zing zhes byas te lta 'dod par gyur to //
translated: When the boy heard the word “Buddha,” which he had never heard before, all of his hairs stood on end and he wanted to see him.

original: de nas des pha ma la gsol te yab yum /
analyzed: de nas des pha ma la gsol te yab yum /
translated: Then he asked his parents, “Mother, Father,

original: bdag yul dbus su mchis te /
analyzed: bdag yul dbus su mchis te /
translated: I want to go to the Middle Country.

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal gyi; gnang bar mdzad du gsol zhes byas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal gyi; gnang bar mdzad du gsol zhes byas so //
translated: Please allow me to go forth and lead the pure life in the Blessed One’s presence.”

original: de nas pha ma gnyis kyis bsam pa /
analyzed: de nas pha ma gnyis kyis bsam pa /
translated: Then his parents thought,

original: 'di ni / bdag cag gis bzlog par mi nus so snyam du rig nas smras pa /
analyzed: 'di ni / bdag cag gis bzlog par mi nus so snyam du rig nas smras pa /
translated: “We cannot dissuade him.”

original: sdod cig dang bdag cag gnyis kyis khyim gyi 'khor btang nas de'i 'og tu lhan cig tu dong la bcom ldan 'das de'i thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: sdod cig dang bdag cag gnyis kyis khyim gyi 'khor btang nas de'i 'og tu lhan cig tu dong la bcom ldan 'das de'i thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bya'o //
translated: They said, “Stay here. We will give up our household affairs, and then we will go together and lead the pure life in the Blessed One’s presence.”

original: zhes de skad smras nas de gnyis kyis khyim gyi 'khor btang ste sbyin pa dag byin zhing bsod nams dag byas nas yul dbus su dong ste /
analyzed: zhes de skad smras nas de gnyis kyis khyim gyi 'khor btang ste sbyin pa dag byin zhing bsod nams dag byas nas yul dbus su dong ste /
translated: Having said this, they gave up their household affairs, gave gifts, made merit, and went to the Middle Country.

original: de dag mthar gyis dong dong ba las rgyal po'i khyim du phyin nas de dag bcom @66b ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ba dang / khye'u de dang de'i pha ma gnyis kyis thag ring po zhig nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan cing spa bar byas pa /
analyzed: de dag mthar gyis dong dong ba las rgyal po'i khyim du phyin nas de dag bcom @66b ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ba dang / khye'u de dang de'i pha ma gnyis kyis thag ring po zhig nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan cing spa bar byas pa /
translated: The child and his parents saw the Blessed Buddha from a distance. He was a great man, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man.

original: me lus kyi dbyibs su 'dug pa lta bu /🔽me lce mar gyis btab pa lta bu /
analyzed: me lus kyi dbyibs su 'dug pa lta bu / me lce mar gyis btab pa lta bu /
translated: He was like a fire in the shape of a body.🔽He was like a flame of fire anointed with ghee.

original: mar me gser gyi snod du bzhag pa lta bu /
analyzed: mar me gser gyi snod du bzhag pa lta bu /
translated: He was like a lamp placed in a golden vessel.

original: mchod sdong rin po che sna tshogs kyis spras pa lta bu /
analyzed: mchod sdong rin po che sna tshogs kyis spras pa lta bu /
translated: He was like a sacrificial post adorned with various jewels.

original: blo gsal zhing dri ma med la rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
analyzed: blo gsal zhing dri ma med la rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
translated: He was the Blessed Buddha, clear-minded, stainless, and pure.

original: mthong nas kyang mchog tu dga' ba skyes te /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang mchog tu dga' ba skyes te /
translated: When they saw him, they were overjoyed.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems can gyis dang po sangs rgyas mthong ba'i nyams bde ba ci 'dra ba de lta bu ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems can gyis dang po sangs rgyas mthong ba'i nyams bde ba ci 'dra ba de lta bu ni /
translated: The bliss that sentient beings who have accumulated roots of virtue experience when they first see a Buddha is such that

original: lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du zhi gnas kyi sems la goms par byas pa la'ang nyams bde ba de lta bu skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du zhi gnas kyi sems la goms par byas pa la'ang nyams bde ba de lta bu skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: even those who have cultivated the mind of meditative serenity for twelve years do not generate such bliss.

original: de ltar mthong nas kyang mchog tu dga' ba skyes so //
analyzed: de ltar mthong nas kyang mchog tu dga' ba skyes so //
translated: Having seen him in this way, they generated supreme joy.

original: dga' ba skyes nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'khod do //
analyzed: dga' ba skyes nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'khod do //
translated: Having generated joy, they went to where the Blessed One was staying. Having arrived, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One and sat before the Blessed One in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing their thoughts, tendencies, temperament, and nature, taught them the Dharma that was appropriate for them.

original: de rnams kyis stan de nyid la 'khod bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po @67a *//
analyzed: de rnams kyis stan de nyid la 'khod bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po @67a *//
translated: While seated on those very seats, with the vajra of knowledge they leveled the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection.

original: nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom 'das rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom 'das rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas so //
translated: They manifested the resultant state of stream entry.

original: de rnams kyis bden pa mthong nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de rnams kyis bden pa mthong nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having seen the truths, they rose from their seats, drew down the right shoulder of their upper garments, bowed toward the Blessed One with palms pressed together, and made this request:

original: btsun pa / bdag cag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /
analyzed: btsun pa / bdag cag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /
translated: “Lord, if permitted we wish to go forth in the Dharma and Vinaya so well spoken, complete our novitiates, and achieve full ordination.

original: bdag cag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bdag cag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
translated: We too would practice the holy life in the presence of the Blessed One.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de gnyis dge slong tshur shog ces bya bas rab tu byung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de gnyis dge slong tshur shog ces bya bas rab tu byung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to them, “Come, monks!” and as he said this, they became renunciates, and their beards and hair fell out and they were clad in robes.

original: de gnyis la lung yang phog ste /🔽de gnyis kyis kyang brtson pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas gser dang bong bar mnyam pa /
analyzed: de gnyis la lung yang phog ste / de gnyis kyis kyang brtson pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas gser dang bong bar mnyam pa /
translated: He gave them the instructions,🔽and they, through diligence, practice, and effort, abandoned all defilements and actualized the state of an arhat.🔽As arhats, they were free from attachment to the three realms.

original: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: They were equal-minded toward gold and filth, their minds were like the earth, their minds were like space, their minds were like a diamond, and their minds were like a medicine tree.

original: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
analyzed: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
translated: They were cool like sandalwood, their eggshells of ignorance were broken,

original: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: they had attained knowledge, clairvoyance, and discerning wisdom,

original: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
analyzed: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /

translated: The door was opened and the husband came in. He was welcomed and served with the proper honors, and then he went to bed with his wife.

translated: While they were sleeping, some thieves broke into the house and came inside. First they opened the cage. They thought,

analyzed: gzeb 'di 'di ltar rgyas legs par btab la lcid las nor bu rin po che chen po yod gor ma chag go /

analyzed: 'dis ni / bdag cag mi rabs bdun gyi bar du'ang chog par 'gyur te /
translated: With this we will be provided for seven generations of our family.

original: 'di kho nas bdag cag chog gi /
analyzed: 'di kho nas bdag cag chog gi /
translated: This alone will be enough for us.🔽We have no need for any other possessions.”

analyzed: bdag cag la rdzas gzhan mi dgos so snyam du bsam nas de dag gis gzeb de gcig pu khyer te phyir byung nas nags 'dabs su khyer ro //
translated: They took only the cage and left. They carried it to the edge of the forest.

original: de dag 'dong ba na zla ba'ang shar la mi des kyang de'i nang du 'dug bzhin du gcin shor nas gcin de gzeb las thar te phyi rol tu zags so //
analyzed: de dag 'dong ba na zla ba'ang shar la mi des kyang de'i nang du 'dug bzhin du gcin shor nas gcin de gzeb las thar te phyi rol tu zags so //
translated: As they were carrying it, the moon rose. The man inside urinated, and the urine came out of the cage and dripped to the ground.🔽Then the thieves thought,

original: de nas rkun po de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas rkun po de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the thieves thought this:

original: 'di ltar zla ba shar ba na 'di'i nang nas chu 'bab pa las na /
analyzed: 'di ltar zla ba shar ba na 'di'i nang nas chu 'bab pa las na /

original: 'di'i nang du ni /
analyzed: 'di'i nang du ni /
translated: Therefore,

original: nor bu chu shel bcug yang dag snyam ste /
analyzed: nor bu chu shel bcug yang dag snyam ste /
translated: I am sure that this gem is a water crystal.”🔽He was overjoyed.

original: lhag par yang snying dga' bar gyur to; ;de nas de dag sha thang ste gzeb de khyer nas nags 'dabs su lhags so //
analyzed: lhag par yang snying dga' bar gyur to; ;de nas de dag sha thang ste gzeb de khyer nas nags 'dabs su lhags so //
translated: “Then, exhausted, they carried the basket to the edge of the forest.

original: de nas mi rgod kyi sde dpon dang mi rgod gzhan dag gis dris pa /
analyzed: de nas mi rgod kyi sde dpon dang mi rgod gzhan dag gis dris pa /
translated: “Then the leader of the wild men and the other wild men asked,

analyzed: khyod kyis gzeb 'di'i nang @71b du ci zhig khyer te 'ongs /

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They replied,

original: sde dpon / deng du ni /
analyzed: sde dpon / deng du ni /
translated: ‘Leader, today

analyzed: bdag cag gis thams cad kyi dbul ba'i rgyun bcad kyi /
translated: we have cut off the stream of poverty for all of us.

original: dgyes pa bskyed du gsol /
analyzed: dgyes pa bskyed du gsol /

analyzed: deng bdag cag gis rin po ches gang ba'i gzeb rnyed do //
translated: Today we have found a basket full of jewels.’

original: zhes byas so //
analyzed: zhes byas so //
translated: Thus it is said.🔽🔽

original: de nas de thos ma thag tu de dag kyang snying dga' bar gyur te smras pa /
analyzed: de nas de thos ma thag tu de dag kyang snying dga' bar gyur te smras pa /
translated: As soon as they heard that, they were overjoyed and said,

analyzed: gzeb phye zhig dang 'dir rin po che ji lta bu dag bcug pa blta'o //
translated: ‘Open the basket and let us see what kind of jewels are in it.’

original: zhes byas so //
analyzed: zhes byas so //
translated: So they said.

original: de nas de dag gis gzeb de dkrol nas kha phye ste bltas na /
analyzed: de nas de dag gis gzeb de dkrol nas kha phye ste bltas na /
translated: Then they untied the cage, opened it, and looked inside.

original: gzeb de'i nang du 'phye bo zhig bcug cing 'dug pa mthong nas mthong ma thag tu der song song ba dang / gzeb de khyer khyer ba gang yin pa de dag ni /

translated: They saw that a cripple had been put inside the cage.

analyzed: 'phye bo 'dis bdag cag mtshan thog thag nyon mongs so snyam nas sdug bsngal bar gyur to //
translated: Those who had gone to carry the cage away thought, “This cripple has made us suffer all night long.”

original: der ma dong ba gang yin pa de dag gis ni /
analyzed: der ma dong ba gang yin pa de dag gis ni /
translated: Those who had not gone there

original: mi rgod der song song ba de dag la gad mo chen pos btab nas smras pa /🔽legs par nyon mongs so //🔽shin tu nyon mongs so //
analyzed: mi rgod der song song ba de dag la gad mo chen pos btab nas smras pa / legs par nyon mongs so // shin tu nyon mongs so //
translated: laughed loudly at those who had gone to the place of the bandits and said,🔽“Listen well!🔽You have suffered a lot!

original: zhes byas so //
analyzed: zhes byas so //
translated: You have suffered very much!”

analyzed: de nas bud med de sad de langs nas khang pa de'i nang du song ba dang khyim phug ste gzeb brkus pa mthong ngo //

analyzed: mthong nas kyang snying dga' nas chigs su bcad de smras pa /

analyzed: bdag ni phyed dga' phyed mi dga'; ;nags 'dabs song ba'i rkun po rnams // da ni rgod cing du  de gzeng de khyer te 'ongs pa gang yin pa de dag khros te smras pa /
translated: “The thieves who went into the forest🔽are now laughing and coming back with their loot.”🔽Those who had been angry said,

original: 'di ltar 'phye po @72a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phye po @72a *//
translated: “This cripple

original: 'dis bdag cag mi dga' bar byas mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dis bdag cag mi dga' bar byas mod kyi /
translated: has made us unhappy.

original: 'on kyang bdag cag gi gnod sbyin mchod dgos kyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag cag gi gnod sbyin mchod dgos kyi /
translated: But we must worship our yakṣa.🔽Let us worship the yakṣa with him.”

analyzed: bdug pa dang me tog dang mchod pa'i cho ga dang bum pa gang pa rnams bzhag nas ral gri rnon po thogs te mi de gnod sbyin gyi mdun du bzhag nas mchod sbyin byas so //
translated: and set out incense, flowers, and offerings, and filled vessels, and took up sharp swords. They placed the man in front of the yakṣa and made an offering.

analyzed: de nas mi des kyang ji ltar bdag nyid gnod sbyin de'i mchod par dbul bar chad pa khong du chud nas shin tu skrag ste bsam pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma gtogs pa su zhig la da bdag skyabs su 'gro bar bya /

analyzed: su zhig bdag la srog phangs pa sbyin par 'gyur snyam du bsam nas des bcom ldan 'das la sems kyis gsol ba btab pa /

analyzed: btsun pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Noble one, the Blessed One🔽does not see, know, or understand anything

analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba ci'ang mi gzigs pa dang mi mkhyen pa dang thugs su mi chud pa mi mnga' na /
translated: in the past, present, or future.

original: kye ma bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: kye ma bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Oh Blessed One!

original: bdag ni / dkos thag cing nyam nga la phongs par gyur pa lags kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni / dkos thag cing nyam nga la phongs par gyur pa lags kyi /

original: bdag yongs su bskyab tu gsol /
analyzed: bdag yongs su bskyab tu gsol /
translated: Please protect me!

original: srog phangs pa stsal du gsol zhes byas so //
analyzed: srog phangs pa stsal du gsol zhes byas so //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'grod pa gcig pu'i lam ston pa /

translated: Through the evolution of that action of making offerings to the solitary buddha and making aspirations, he was born into a family that was rich and had great wealth and many possessions, and he became well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful, with a body color like the center of a lotus.

analyzed: dog lta bur gyur te /

He was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful, and his body was the color of the center of a lotus.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

translated: He went forth in my very doctrine, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifested arhatship.”

translated: Then, at a later time, the child found faith in the doctrine of the Blessed One. From time to time he went to the garden of Prince Jeta and listened to the Blessed One teach the Dharma.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas bsnyen par rdzogs par byas so //

analyzed: bdag gis 'dul bar 'gyur ba 'ga' lta yod dam snyam pa dang / des thog ma kho nar pha ma gnyis 'dul bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //

analyzed: sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i bgo bsha' bya ba la'ang btsud de /

analyzed: dge slong dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa de la'ang bza' ba dang bca' ba gtsang ma bzang po sbyar to //

analyzed: de nas dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /

analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i bshan pa'i rigs su'ang skyes la /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la'ang rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis /
translated: Why did he go forth in the doctrine of the Blessed One, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifest arhatship?

analyzed: khyim pa'i tshe dang / rab tu byung ba'i tshe na'ang bza' ba dang bca' ba bzang po dang ldan par gyur lags /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang las gyur to //

analyzed: btsun pa / 'dis gang du smon lam btab lags /
translated: “Lord, where did he make those aspirations?”

original: dge slong dag /

translated: “Monks,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na ri khrod cig na bshan pa mang po dag cig skyed mos tshal gyi nang du dong ste bza' ba dang bca' ba bzang po mang po bshams pa las /🔽rang sangs rgyas shig skyed mos tshal der bsod snyoms la 'ongs nas de bshan pa'i mi zhig gis mthong ste /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na ri khrod cig na bshan pa mang po dag cig skyed mos tshal gyi nang du dong ste bza' ba dang bca' ba bzang po mang po bshams pa las / rang sangs rgyas shig skyed mos tshal der bsod snyoms la 'ongs nas de bshan pa'i mi zhig gis mthong ste /
translated: “In the past, in a certain forest, many butchers went into a pleasure grove and prepared many good things to eat and drink.🔽A solitary buddha came to that pleasure grove for alms.

original: mthong ma thag tu bshan pa'i mi de rang sangs rgyas de la shin tu dga' ba skyes te /
analyzed: mthong ma thag tu bshan pa'i mi de rang sangs rgyas de la shin tu dga' ba skyes te /
translated: As soon as a certain man among the butchers saw the solitary buddha, he felt a surge of joy toward the solitary buddha.

original: dga' ba skyes nas rang sangs rgyas de la bza' ba dang bca' ba gtsang ma bzang po mang po phul lo //
analyzed: dga' ba skyes nas rang sangs rgyas de la bza' ba dang bca' ba gtsang ma bzang po mang po phul lo //
translated: Feeling joy, he offered the solitary buddha many good, wholesome foods.

original: bdag nyid chen po de dag ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po de dag ni /
translated: Great beings

original: lus kyis chos ston par byed kyi /
analyzed: lus kyis chos ston par byed kyi /
translated: teach the Dharma with their bodies,

original: tshig gis ston par mi byed de /
analyzed: tshig gis ston par mi byed de /
translated: not with words.

original: des der bsod snyoms blangs nas de nyid du steng gi nam mkha' la song ngo //
analyzed: des der bsod snyoms blangs nas de nyid du steng gi nam mkha' la song ngo //
translated: After he had received alms there, he rose up into the sky right in that place.

original: de nas mi des mthong nas lhag par @113a *//
analyzed: de nas mi des mthong nas lhag par @113a *//
translated: When the man saw that, he felt even more

original: yang dga' ba skyes so //
analyzed: yang dga' ba skyes so //
translated: joy.

original: de dga' ba skyes nas smon lam btab pa /
analyzed: de dga' ba skyes nas smon lam btab pa /
translated: He was delighted and made this aspiration:

original: kye ma dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i bshan pa'i rigs su skyes la /🔽bza' ba dang bca' ba bzang po dang yang ldan pa dang / bdag sdig pa'i las de'ang mi byed pa dang / 'di bas kyang ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i ston pa mnyes par byed par gyur cig /
analyzed: kye ma dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i bshan pa'i rigs su skyes la / bza' ba dang bca' ba bzang po dang yang ldan pa dang / bdag sdig pa'i las de'ang mi byed pa dang / 'di bas kyang ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i ston pa mnyes par byed par gyur cig /
translated: “Oh! By this root of virtue, wherever I am born, may it be into a family of butchers who are wealthy, have much property, and enjoy great wealth.

original: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /
analyzed: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /
translated: May I have good food and drink, and may I not commit any evil deeds. May I please and not displease a teacher even more exalted than this one.

original: yon tan gyi tshogs 'di lta bu dag kyang thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: yon tan gyi tshogs 'di lta bu dag kyang thob par gyur cig /
translated: May I attain a great heap of good qualities such as this.”

original: de kho na'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par gyur cig ces byas so //
analyzed: de kho na'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par gyur cig ces byas so //
translated: He went forth in his doctrine, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifested arhatship.”

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Bhikṣus,

original: ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: ji snyam du sems /

analyzed: de'i tshe bshan par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /

original: dge slong 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: dge slong 'di nyid yin te /
translated: “Monks, he was indeed this monk.

original: des rang sangs rgyas de la bshos phul nas smon lam btab pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i bshan ba'i rigs su skyes nas gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes🔽par gyur te /
analyzed: des rang sangs rgyas de la bshos phul nas smon lam btab pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i bshan ba'i rigs su skyes nas gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes par gyur te /
translated: As a result of the evolution of his action of offering food to the solitary buddha and making a vow, wherever he was born, it was into a family of butchers who were rich, had great wealth, and great possessions. He was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful.

original: bza' ba dang bca' ba bzang po dang yang ldan par gyur la /

analyzed: des sdig pa'i las kyang ma byas te /
translated: He did not do any bad actions.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: nga rang sangs rgyas bye ba phrag 'bum pas kyang ches lhag par khyad par du 'phags pa de lta bu 'dis mnyes par @113b byas te mi mnyes par ma byas /
analyzed: nga rang sangs rgyas bye ba phrag 'bum pas kyang ches lhag par khyad par du 'phags pa de lta bu 'dis mnyes par @113b byas te mi mnyes par ma byas /
translated: this monk, who is even more distinguished than a hundred thousand million solitary buddhas, pleased me, but did not displease me.

original: nga nyid kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: nga nyid kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
translated: He went forth in my very doctrine, abandoned all the defilements, and actualized the state of an arhat.”

original: gzhan yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi bstan pa la 'di rab tu byung nas der 'dis tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad de 'chi khar smon lam btab pa /🔽yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gis bram ze'i khye'u bla ma lung bstan pa gang yin pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bdag gis mnyes par byed par gyur cig /
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi bstan pa la 'di rab tu byung nas der 'dis tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad de 'chi khar smon lam btab pa / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gis bram ze'i khye'u bla ma lung bstan pa gang yin pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bdag gis mnyes par byed par gyur cig /
translated: “Moreover, he went forth in the doctrine of the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa, and for his whole life he practiced pure conduct. At the time of his death, he prayed,

original: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /
analyzed: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /
